data: Rectangular block of pale yellow stone, border worn or cut away, around a smoothly finished face, on whihc a dense, lightly incised, somewhat cursive text is set out. The stone has been sawn off from the original rock to which it belonged. The left margin of the inscribed face is intact, damage to the top obliterates much of the first line; the right margin is intact to line 8, and thereafter increasingly cut away. The lower edge is missing, perhaps 1-2 lines lost.
First line is hard against the left margin, the rest shows a hanging indent of 1-2 letter spaces, 16 lines survive.
I.Sicily with the permission of the Assessorato Regionale dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana - Dipartimento dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana; photo J. Prag 2013-10-02

An outstanding collection of archaeological material. The collection ranges from Siracusa and the surrounding territory (Megara Hyblaia, Akrai, Kasmenai etc) to encompass all of eastern Sicily, reaching as far as Gela and Agrigento. The ground floor covers prehistory through to the end of the Classical period. Upstairs includes Hellenistic and Roman Syracuse and a display of material from the catacombs. A gallery displaying material from Hellenistic eastern Sicily is in preparation.
Association pour l’encouragement des études greques, « Bulletin épigraphique », Revue des études grecques, 1888, http://www.worldcat.org/oclc/797735566

Italy Sicily Siracusa Museo Archeologico Regionale Paolo Orsi 19227 Ancient Greek

Rectangular block of pale yellow stone, border worn or cut away, around a smoothly finished face, on whihc a dense, lightly incised, somewhat cursive text is set out. The stone has been sawn off from the original rock to which it belonged. The left margin of the inscribed face is intact, damage to the top obliterates much of the first line; the right margin is intact to line 8, and thereafter increasingly cut away. The lower edge is missing, perhaps 1-2 lines lost.

limestone rock face

First line is hard against the left margin, the rest shows a hanging indent of 1-2 letter spaces, 16 lines survive.

chiselled Line 1-16 4-5 Interlineation line 1 to 2 Buscemi 37.0790016, 14.8863106 35 CE Original discovery not recorded. Depositi, Mag C (Buscemi) 2006.04; 2013.10.02

ἐπὶ ὑπάτων Γαΐου · Κεστί ου Μάρκου Σερουιλίου Νω νιανοῦ · ἀμφιπόλου δὲ ἐν Συρακούσαις · Αὔλου · Βαλερί ου Ἀραβικοῦ τᾶν δὲ Παί δων · Λουκίου · Βηβηίου Κλάδου ἱερείας δὲ Κλωδίας Πώλ λας μηνὸς Πανάμου ϛκ παρεγένοντο πρὸς τὰς Παῖδας μετὰ Αὐλίας Τίτου θυγατέρος Φαβία Σφονγέος ἡ μήτηρ καὶ Φάβιλ λα θυγάτηρ καὶ Ἀπία τῇ τριακάδι εὐφρανθέντες καὶ εὐχαριστοῦντες Ἀπόλ λωνι καὶ Παίδεσσι
